item.title: Is Post Malone culpable for exploiting hip-hop?
item.author: Jordan Bunke,
item.description: The 2010s have marked a significant shift in the music industry and music consumption in two interesting ways: platform and genre. Consumers are increasingly moving away from purchasing music, whether vinyl, CDs, or downloads, and moving towards streaming. As part of their efforts to accurately …

item.title: The soul of hip-hop: why J. Cole’s status as a member of rap’s elite trifecta can no longer be disputed
item.author: Jordan Bunke,
item.description: J. Cole is a singularly intriguing figure in hip-hop. Over the course of his ten-year career, one can observe significant growth in almost every facet of his psyche. Whether it is his relationship with the lifestyle he has dreamt of for so many years, or his musings on his identity as a biracial …
